Gen1:1
BBEAt the first God made the heaven and the earth.
CUVS起初　神创造天地。
CUVpyqi chu _ shen chuang zao tian di .
ESVIn the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.
KJVIn the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
NIVIn the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
e_Note
2412 27_163723(ed). 240311 _175329_ed.
  1. Jhn1:1 get ======p000
  2.  Background service. 
  3. Elohim is Plural form, not only means the triune God, but also means God is relational God. The relationship is from God and for God. 
  4. Relationship is a fundamental element of the culture. 
  5. Culture is an environment with a complicated net of the relationships. 
  6. Cultured relationships can produce fruits. 
  7. Before Jesus, we knew only partially knew god who is powerful. Jesus show all nature of God. 
  8. Chinese language cannot tell the plural. 
Gen1:2
BBEAnd the earth was waste and without form; and it was dark on the face of the deep: and the Spirit of God was moving on the face of the waters.
CUVS地是空虚混沌．渊面黑暗．　神的灵运行在水面上。
CUVpydi shi kong xu hun dun . yuan mian hei an . _ shen de ling yun xing zai shui mian shang .
ESVThe earth was without form and void, and darkness was over the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God was hovering over the face of the waters.
KJVAnd the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
NIVNow the earth was formless and empty, darkness was over the surface of the deep, and the Spirit of God was hovering over the waters.
e_Note
240919_093757(ed).
  1. Water analog to trinity. 
  2. formless=useless; formlessness, confusion, unreality, emptiness;
  3. void=invalid; illegal. 
  4. darkness=obscurity; secret place; puzzle; mystery;
  5. Jesus walked on waters. (Mat14:26) (Mak6:48) (Jhn6:19) 
  6. Triune: God, Spirit and Jesus. 
Gen1:3
BBEAnd God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
CUVS神说、要有光、就有了光。
CUVpyshen shuo , yao you guang , jiu you le guang .
ESVAnd God said, "Let there be light," and there was light.
KJVAnd God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
NIVAnd God said, "Let there be light," and there was light.
e_Note
240919_083154(ed).
  1. in Pro8:30. God said, Jesus finished. Spirit is light. 
  2. we plural 
  3.  light is Jesus 
  4.  spirit over water Gen1:2 and Mat14:25
  5. God's Desire is Reality--perfect joyful unit.
Gen1:4
BBEAnd God, looking on the light, saw that it was good: and God made a division between the light and the dark,
CUVS神看光是好的、就把光暗分开了。
CUVpyshen kan guang shi hao de , jiu ba guang an fen kai le .
ESVAnd God saw that the light was good. And God separated the light from the darkness.
KJVAnd God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.
NIVGod saw that the light was good, and he separated the light from the darkness.
e_Note
240919_083159(ed).
  1. --God separated the light from the darkness--the light already existed but mixed in the formless and void. 
  2. --God separated us as holy from the formless and void. 
  3. Consecrate to me every firstborn male. The first offspring of every womb among the Israelites belongs to me, whether man or animal.(Exo13:2 NIV)
  4. "And for their sake I consecrate myself, that they also may be sanctified in truth." (Jhn17:19 ESV)
  5. God saw the light was good--God love light--God love Jesus
  6. the son of the light.
Gen1:15
BBEAnd let them be for lights in the arch of heaven to give light on the earth: and it was so.
CUVS并要发光在天空、普照在地上．事就这样成了。
CUVpybing yao fa guang zai tian kong , pu zhao zai di shang . shi jiu zhe yang cheng le .
ESVand let them be lights in the expanse of the heavens to give light upon the earth." And it was so.
KJVAnd let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.
NIVand let them be lights in the expanse of the sky to give light on the earth." And it was so.
e_Note
Jhn1-18
Gen1:31
BBEAnd God saw everything which he had made and it was very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.
CUVS神看着一切所造的都甚好．有晚上、有早晨、是第六日。
CUVpyshen kan zhao yi qie suo zao de dou shen hao . you wan shang , you zao chen , shi di liu ri .
ESVAnd God saw everything that he had made, and behold, it was very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.
KJVAnd God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.
NIVGod saw all that he had made, and it was very good. And there was evening, and there was morning - the sixth day.
e_Note
  1. God did not say ‘good’ immediately after man was created the same as when living creatures was created (25). 
  2. God said ‘good’ twice in the sixth day, one is for living creatures another is for the whole thing created in the sixth day. The most important created man seems underestimated or overlooked. 
  3. Man is special compared to other creatures—Man has not pleased God yet until Jesus redeem it "And a voice came from heaven, "You are my beloved Son; with you I am well pleased."" (Mak1:11 ESV)
  4. Only man created with male and female — man and cloned-man. 
Gen2:7
BBEAnd the Lord God made man from the dust of the earth, breathing into him the breath of life: and man became a living soul.
CUVS耶和华　神用地上的尘土造人、将生气吹在他鼻孔里、他就成了有灵的活人、名叫亚当。
CUVpyye he hua _ shen yong di shang de chen tu zao ren , jiang sheng qi chui zai ta bi kong li , ta jiu cheng le you ling de huo ren , ming jiao ya dang .
ESVthen the LORD God formed the man of dust from the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living creature.
KJVAnd the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
NIVthe Lord God formed the man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living being.
e_Note
  1. Further details of man: 3 and(steps).
  2. A.) dust B.) pant(blow) life into nose. C.) became living (חַיָּֽה) soul (נֶ֥פֶשׁ)
  3. The living soul has two part: וַיִּפַּח בְּאַפָּיו      נִשְׁמַת חַיִּים
  4. life (חַיִּים )
  5. breath (נִשְׁמַת),  fr primative root נָשַׁם to pant(blow), of woman in travail or labor. 
  6. nostril (בְּאַפָּיו) --> dust (עָפָר)
  7. blow (וַיִּפַּח ), both blow and nostril has פָּ
  8. lving(חַיָּֽה), same root as life, related to the LORD YHWH
  9. soul (נֶפֶשׁ). = breath (נִשְׁמַת) + nose (פָּ) dust (עָפָר)
  10. spirit (רוּחַ Ruah, wind, breath, Gen1:2) but not exist here. The first man does not have spirit but soul only.
  11. https://wdingbox.github.io/pubs/biblestudy/my_papers/docs/Spirit_Soul.pdf
  12. The passive voice in English help to understand the position relative relationship. 
  13. Refer to: Eph2:10 (2:7–2:10)
Gen2:18
BBEAnd the Lord God said, It is not good for the man to be by himself: I will make one like himself as a help to him
CUVS耶和华　神说、那人独居不好、我要为他造一个配偶帮助他。
CUVpyye he hua _ shen shuo , na ren du ju bu hao , wo yao wei ta zao yi ge pei ou bang zhu ta .
ESVThen the LORD God said, "It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him a helper fit for him."
KJVAnd the LORD God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.
NIVThe Lord God said, "It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make a helper suitable for him."
e_Note
  1. a helper refer to Jesus. God created Adam but creator and creature cannot stand side by side shoulder by shoulder. One is unlimited and one is limited even he is not sinner. 
  2. In Hebrew ezer
Gen2:24
BBEFor this cause will a man go away from his father and his mother and be joined to his wife; and they will be one flesh.
CUVS因此、人要离开父母、与妻子连合、二人成为一体。
CUVpyyin ci , ren yao li kai fu mu , yu qi zi lian he , er ren cheng wei yi ti .
ESVTherefore a man shall leave his father and his mother and hold fast to his wife, and they shall become one flesh.
KJVTherefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.
NIVFor this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and they will become one flesh.
e_Note
  1. Context is before the fall. 
  2. a process from helper to wife who refer to Jesus' incarnation.
  3. to parents refer to the world, but honor your parents which is culture. 
  4. Leave parents to reborn even he was not sinned. 
  5. ref Eph5:31, Mat19:5-6
  6. A proclamation the creation of man is done but not yet. 
  7. The turning point of Adam in life. 
Gen2:25
BBEAnd the man and his wife were without clothing, and they had no sense of shame.
CUVS当时夫妻二人、赤身露体、并不羞耻。
CUVpydang shi fu qi er ren , chi shen lu ti , bing bu xiu chi .
ESVAnd the man and his wife were both naked and were not ashamed.
KJVAnd they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.
NIVThe man and his wife were both naked, and they felt no shame.
e_Note
  1. Again Until Rom1:16 law shamed because of Gospel. 
Gen3:1
BBENow the snake was wiser than any beast of the field which the Lord God had made. And he said to the woman, Has God truly said that you may not take of the fruit of any tree in the garden?
CUVS耶和华　神所造的、惟有蛇比田野一切的活物更狡猾。蛇对女人说、　神岂是真说、不许你们吃园中所有树上的果子么。
CUVpyye he hua _ shen suo zao de , wei you she bi tian ye yi qie de huo wu geng jiao hua . she dui nv ren shuo , _ shen qi shi zhen shuo , bu xu ni men chi yuan zhong suo you shu shang de guo zi ma .
ESVNow the serpent was more crafty than any other beast of the field that the LORD God had made. He said to the woman, "Did God actually say, 'You shall not eat of any tree in the garden'?"
KJVNow the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?
NIVNow the serpent was more crafty than any of the wild animals the Lord God had made. He said to the woman, "Did God really say, 'You must not eat from any tree in the garden'?"
e_Note
--- 1.) steal speech right of man for different types.   2.) Affirmative command became questionable. 3.) unique Lord God became pan god. 4.) true mixed in false. (syncretism)  5.) create word of true, question. 6.) modification concept. 7.) attractive to change attention (behold to it). 8.)  to think  9.) break silence, to speak 10.) cause to answer to make conversation.        

1. More craft than animals  but under God. 
2. Man is not animal. 
3. Man and animals can communicate. 
4. God created animals unequally. 
5. Evil came from animal 
6. Jesus said man should be as shrewd as snake so that man can be equal to it. Not greater than it. Mat10:1 6 
7. 
Gen3:2
BBEAnd the woman said, We may take of the fruit of the trees in the garden:
CUVS女人对蛇说、园中树上的果子我们可以吃．
CUVpynv ren dui she shuo , yuan zhong shu shang de guo zi wo men ke yi chi .
ESVAnd the woman said to the serpent, "We may eat of the fruit of the trees in the garden,
KJVAnd the woman said unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:
NIVThe woman said to the serpent, "We may eat fruit from the trees in the garden,
e_Note
The weakness of Eve: 1.) misuse personal identity. 2.) open communication channel to Serpent. (excuse)   3.) inaccurate obscure 3a.) eternal become past finished tense. 3b.) add touch to die.    4.) attitude to judge God. 5.) gossip secret of God. 6) fall in love with Serpent

CUVS蛇对女人说、你们不一定死、
CUVpyshe dui nv ren shuo , ni men bu yi ding si ,
ESVBut the serpent said to the woman, "You will not surely die.
KJVAnd the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die:
NIV"You will not surely die," the serpent said to the woman.

Gen3:7
BBEAnd their eyes were open and they were conscious that they had no clothing and they made themselves coats of leaves stitched together.
CUVS他们二人的眼睛就明亮了、才知道自己是赤身露体、便拿无花果树的叶子、为自己编作裙子。
CUVpyta men er ren de yan jing jiu ming liang le , cai zhi dao zi ji shi chi shen lu ti , bian na wu hua guo shu de ye zi , wei zi ji bian zuo qun zi .
ESVThen the eyes of both were opened, and they knew that they were naked. And they sewed fig leaves together and made themselves loincloths.
KJVAnd the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.
NIVThen the eyes of both of them were opened, and they realized they were naked; so they sewed fig leaves together and made coverings for themselves.
e_Note
fig leaf=cover=liar=art=>Mat21:19-curse fig tree; 
Fig leave us like hand. 
Gen10:8
BBEAnd Cush was the father of Nimrod, who was the first of the great men of the earth.

ESVCush fathered Nimrod; he was the first on earth to be a mighty man.
KJVAnd Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
NIVCush was the father of Nimrod, who grew to be a mighty warrior on the earth.

Gen11:7
BBECome, let us go down and take away the sense of their language, so that they will not be able to make themselves clear to one another.
CUVS我们下去、在那里变乱他们的口音、使他们的言语、彼此不通。
CUVpywo men xia qu , zai na li bian luan ta men de kou yin , shi ta men de yan yu , bi ci bu tong .
ESVCome, let us go down and there confuse their language, so that they may not understand one another's speech."
KJVGo to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another's speech.
NIVCome, let us go down and confuse their language so they will not understand each other."
e_Note
The beginning of multiple languages is the beginning of different culutres. God's remedy to prolong the life of race, to prepare for the 1st coming of Jesus Christ to glory Him, prepare for the OT and NT with two more languages. Cross reference language is to serve as mirror to know selves.  
Gen12:2
BBEAnd I will make of you a great nation, blessing you and making your name great; and you will be a blessing:
CUVS我必叫你成为大国．我必赐福给你、叫你的名为大、你也要叫别人得福．
CUVpywo bi jiao ni cheng wei da guo . wo bi ci fu gei ni , jiao ni de ming wei da , ni ye yao jiao bie ren de fu .
ESVAnd I will make of you a great nation, and I will bless you and make your name great, so that you will be a blessing.
KJVAnd I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing:
NIV"I will make you into a great nation and I will bless you; I will make your name great, and you will be a blessing.
e_Note

  2. Great name
  3. Be Blessed
  4. Be helped 
  5. The light and bless of all nations 
  6. Give this land to your offspring. (7)
Gen12:4
BBESo Abram went as the Lord had said to him, and Lot went with him: Abram was seventy-five years old when he went away from Haran.
CUVS亚伯兰就照着耶和华的吩咐去了．罗得也和他同去．亚伯兰出哈兰的时候、年七十五岁。
CUVpyya bo lan jiu zhao zhao ye he hua de fen fu qu le . luo de ye he ta tong qu . ya bo lan chu ha lan de shi hou , nian qi shi wu sui .
ESVSo Abram went, as the LORD had told him, and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he departed from Haran.
KJVSo Abram departed, as the LORD had spoken unto him; and Lot went with him: and Abram was seventy and five years old when he departed out of Haran.
NIVSo Abram left, as the Lord had told him; and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he set out from Haran.
e_Note
  1. Abraham started @75, Died @ 17 5. Immigrant for 100 years. 
  2. Sara started 65 died @ 127. 
  3. Issac born @100 of Abraham, married @40. Twin @60
Gen15:10
BBEAll these he took, cutting them in two and putting one half opposite the other, but not cutting the birds in two.
CUVS亚伯兰就取了这些来、每样劈开分成两半、一半对着一半的摆列、只有鸟没有劈开。
CUVpyya bo lan jiu qu le zhe xie lai , mei yang pi kai fen cheng liang ban , yi ban dui zhao yi ban de bai lie , zhi you niao mei you pi kai .
ESVAnd he brought him all these, cut them in half, and laid each half over against the other. But he did not cut the birds in half.
KJVAnd he took unto him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: but the birds divided he not.
NIVAbram brought all these to him, cut them in two and arranged the halves opposite each other; the birds, however, he did not cut in half.
e_Note
  1. God bloodily classified man by righteousness and unrighteousness bloodily. Gen 6:9, Gen15:6. 
Gen22:24
BBEAnd his servant Reumah gave birth to Tebah and Gaham and Tahash and Maacah.
CUVS拿鹤的妾名叫流玛、生了提八、迦含、他辖、和玛迦。
CUVpyna he de qie ming jiao liu ma , sheng le ti ba , jia han , ta xia , he ma jia .
ESVMoreover, his concubine, whose name was Reumah, bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.
KJVAnd his concubine, whose name was Reumah, she bare also Tebah, and Gaham, and Thahash, and Maachah.
NIVHis concubine, whose name was Reumah, also had sons: Tebah, Gaham, Tahash and Maacah.

  1. How was Isaac after that? (ref)
Gen23:1
BBENow the years of Sarah's life were a hundred and twenty-seven.
CUVS撒拉享寿一百二十七岁、这是撒拉一生的岁数。
CUVpysa la xiang shou yi bai er shi qi sui , zhe shi sa la yi sheng de sui shu .
ESVSarah lived 127 years; these were the years of the life of Sarah.
KJVAnd Sarah was an hundred and seven and twenty years old: these were the years of the life of Sarah.
NIVSarah lived to be a hundred and twenty-seven years old.
e_Note
5>Common secular delima5>
  1. Ages: Abraham 137, Isaac 37. The death of Sara occurred after test. So Isaac was likely about 33 close to the age of Jesus on cross -- many people cannot accept virgins birth of Jesus. It is not something new but has been hinted and predicted again and again in ancient time before Jesus. Isaac: virgin birth of Jesus; Joseph: the administration of Jesus. 
  2. Close kinship marriage: Sara is the younger sister of Abraham’s father. The higher the human age, the more like the kinship marriage. 
    Types of woman pregnancy (1) biological (2) spiritual pregnancy. Both were accounted in ancient Chinese books. It’s not strange that Jesus was born from Virgin Mary. Human gen is devolution process due the sins. 
  3. Takeaway from  Abraham:
    (1) Mormon follows errorless follow Abraham.
    (2) Noah and the great men in ancient times are greater than Abraham
    (3) The key of Abraham is the trust of the Lord.
    (4) The only perfect person we should learn is Jesus. No righteousness in the world. Do not search idols among them. 
Gen23:2
BBEAnd Sarah's death took place in Kiriath-arba, that is, Hebron, in the land of Canaan: and Abraham went into his house, weeping and sorrowing for Sarah.
CUVS撒拉死在迦南地的基列亚巴、就是希伯仑、亚伯拉罕为他哀恸哭号。
CUVpysa la si zai jia nan di de ji lie ya ba , jiu shi xi bo lun , ya bo la han wei ta ai tong ku hao .
ESVAnd Sarah died at Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan, and Abraham went in to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her.
KJVAnd Sarah died in Kirjatharba; the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan: and Abraham came to mourn for Sarah, and to weep for her.
NIVShe died at Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan, and Abraham went to mourn for Sarah and to weep over her.
e_Note
  1. mourn: in heart in inner spiritual part. Is invisible and  Cannot be pretentious. 
  2. Weep: in feeling physically when harmed. Is visible. Can be pretended. 
Why did Abraham mourn and weep? He was so sad that he couldn’t stand until he finally rose from beside his dead wife (3). 
  1. barren (Gen11:30), beautiful(Gen12:11), the same father of Abraham.  (Abraham's  most closest buddy)  
  2. Devoted follower of husband and God. Where he went, where she went, from Ur to Haran, to Cannan to Egypt. No complain.
  3. Obedence: Abraham's closest and most comprehensive buddy and servant. Never rebel, do whatever orders(Gen18:6) 
  4. Bear suffering for wrong doing: 2x in Egypt (Gen12:11, Gen20:2), 我因你受屈 (Gen16:5)
  5. Actively help and support husband: give servant to husband (Gen 16:2). 
  6. Drove out the conterfeit sons. jealous the servant son because of Isaac. Jesus came into our life, the fake one will be driven away. 
  7. Greatest achievement: delivery a son for herself, for Abraham and for God.
  8. The first and only women that her name was changed from Sarai(princess,公主,王妃) to Sarah by God. Sarah=mother of nations; kings of people will come from her (Gen 17:15), replaced Eve the mother of all living (Gen3:20). God intervened human history.
  9. God rename Abraham Sarai, Jacob (Isreal) Jesus (Simon->Peter, Saul->Paul)
  10. Model family for today:wife->husband->God. Mother's Day should remember her. 
  11. The death of Sarah is a kind of martyrs. 
 
Gen23:3
BBEAnd Abraham came from his dead and said to the children of Heth,
CUVS后来亚伯拉罕从死人面前起来、对赫人说、
CUVpyhou lai ya bo la han cong si ren mian qian qi lai , dui he ren shuo ,
ESVAnd Abraham rose up from before his dead and said to the Hittites,
KJVAnd Abraham stood up from before his dead, and spake unto the sons of Heth, saying,
NIVThen Abraham rose from beside his dead wife and spoke to the Hittites. He said,
e_Note
  1. Meaning of Sarah's death: Abraham died. 
  2. It’s not easy for him to standup with such sorrows. The driven power for Abraham to rise from his dead wife is the faith of God. He has hope and his hope was his son. If no son, old Abraham would not live. Abraham could truly standup in front of us today is because Jesus rose from death. Abraham defeated the temptation and finished the mission that God gave to him. 
  3. Face to the death and enemy: Hittites: the grandson of Cannan (Gen10:15)
Gen23:15
BBEMy lord, give ear to me: the value of the land is four hundred shekels; what is that between me and you? so put your dead to rest there.
CUVS我主请听、值四百舍客勒银子的一块田、在你我中间还算甚么呢、只管埋葬你的死人吧。
CUVpywo zhu qing ting , zhi si bai she ke le yin zi de yi kuai tian , zai ni wo zhong jian hai suan shen ma ne , zhi guan mai zang ni de si ren ba .
ESV"My lord, listen to me: a piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver, what is that between you and me? Bury your dead."
KJVMy lord, hearken unto me: the land is worth four hundred shekels of silver; what is that betwixt me and thee? bury therefore thy dead.
NIV"Listen to me, my lord; the land is worth four hundred shekels of silver, but what is that between me and you? Bury your dead."
e_Note
  1. a:  Hebrew unit equal to about 252 grains troy.
    b: a unit of value based on a shekel weight of gold or silver.
    A shekel was first a unit of weight-very roughly 11 grams (0.39 oz)

    1 denarius (Biblical Roman) = 0.337719298245614 shekel (Biblical Hebrew) 
     
  2. "So when the merchants came by, his brothers pulled Joseph up out of the cistern and sold him for twenty shekels of silver to the Ishmaelites, who took him to Egypt." Note: A shekel is 14 grams of silver. (Gen 37:12-36)
  3. Both Abraham and Ephron are rich but differ the faith.
Gen23:16
BBEAnd Abraham took note of the price fixed by Ephron in the hearing of the children of Heth, and gave him four hundred shekels in current money.
CUVS亚伯拉罕听从了以弗仑、照着他在赫人面前所说的话、把买卖通用的银子、平了四百舍客勒给以弗仑。
CUVpyya bo la han ting cong le yi fu lun , zhao zhao ta zai he ren mian qian suo shuo de hua , ba mai mai tong yong de yin zi , ping le si bai she ke le gei yi fu lun .
ESVAbraham listened to Ephron, and Abraham weighed out for Ephron the silver that he had named in the hearing of the Hittites, four hundred shekels of silver, according to the weights current among the merchants.
KJVAnd Abraham hearkened unto Ephron; and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver, which he had named in the audience of the sons of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, current money with the merchant.
NIVAbraham agreed to Ephron's terms and weighed out for him the price he had named in the hearing of the Hittites: four hundred shekels of silver, according to the weight current among the merchants.
e_Note
Comparison of Abraham and Ephron
  Abraham Ephron notes
Fame the great (world) big (local) partial to the world
Nation small yet big (local)  
bless blessed in treasure blessed in materials seen
-condition no friendly to Abrahm both from God
-thanks grateful to God unkown  
Status immigrant.  local landlord partial
-authority no (ask)  price determiner (answer) 400
-generosity generous generous both rich, no delt.
-kindness bow down permit without troubles  
-worship God idol  
-faith God money  
-pride sorrow self-prid  
-greatness self-humiliate  self-great  
-justice justice in God justice in in world  
BigDeal official worldly official  G23:18, big news
Eternal deal until today deny   
 
  1. There are similarities btw Abraham and Ephron.sound nice. But he was proud, look down money, he wanted to be higher than Abraham. 
  2. Both Abraham and Ephron are rich but differ the faith.
  3. Looks like a just business and political affair, but indeed is a spiritual war. 
  4. Looks like Abraham is a loser, but Abraham was pleased to God.
  5. While finishing a big bussiness deal with Hitties, he unwittly also accomplished the mission of God. 
  6. The mission of God was accomplished during the sorrow times rather than joyful time. 
  7. Ephron was blessed through Abraham through a peace treaty and  justice deal by giving moeny without bargin. 
  8. God's promise never failed. 
Gen23:20
BBEAnd the field and the hollow rock were handed over to Abraham as his property by the children of Heth.
CUVS从此、那块田、和田间的洞、就借着赫人定准、归与亚伯拉罕作坟地。
CUVpycong ci , na kuai tian , he tian jian de dong , jiu jie zhao he ren ding zhun , gui yu ya bo la han zuo fen di .
ESVThe field and the cave that is in it were made over to Abraham as property for a burying place by the Hittites.
KJVAnd the field, and the cave that is therein, were made sure unto Abraham for a possession of a buryingplace by the sons of Heth.
NIVSo the field and the cave in it were deeded to Abraham by the Hittites as a burial site.
e_Note
 
Sarah:
A. Delima:
1. Age 
2. Incest marriage.  
Charater of Sarah
  1. obedience. "Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord. " (1 Pe3:6 ESV) The first good family model - wife obey husband and husband obey God.
  2.  
  3.  
  4.  
  5. Abraham bought the land of cannon. It seems that it is a simple and boring story. But why it takes 18 verses to record it? Gen is about the origin of the world and whole human history. Each single word is precious and important. 
  6. God promised Abraham that I will give your land to your offsprings. (Gen12:7). But God did not tell him how. 
  7. What is the blessing of God? How people misunderstand the blessing of God. 
  8. Abraham's important question: O the Lord, How can I know that I will gain the possession of it? (Gen 15:8)
  9. Abraham is richer than Ephron, because God was with him. But Abraham buy the land until wife died. why did not he buy early? 
Gen24:1
BBENow Abraham was old and far on in years: and the Lord had given him everything in full measure.
CUVS亚伯拉罕年纪老迈、向来在一切事上、耶和华都赐福给他。
CUVpyya bo la han nian ji lao mai , xiang lai zai yi qie shi shang , ye he hua dou ci fu gei ta .
ESVNow Abraham was old, well advanced in years. And the LORD had blessed Abraham in all things.
KJVAnd Abraham was old, and well stricken in age: and the LORD had blessed Abraham in all things.
NIVAbraham was now old and well advanced in years, and the Lord had blessed him in every way.
e_Note
  1. How old? Badnews: (a) No answer for 1st time reader. Goodnews: know it after read. Same way for bless. (b) 1 40=100+40(Gen25:20)
  2. What is fuzzy concept of old? 140/175=0.8 yrs (Gen25:7). Methuselah玛土撒拉 969 yrs(Gen5:27). Jared雅列 962 yrs, dad of Enoch(Gen5:20). Noah 950=600+350 yrs (Gen7:6, Gen9:28- Gen9:29)
  3. Is old good or bad? Prefer young. Next is death; the biggest enemy. 
  4. Why old links bless? in every way, not some way. Including old. (a) healthy/wealth, land, country, name (b)mission使命(success/nations). (Gen1 2:2-Gen12:3)
  5. "How do I know?" Gen15:8. (a) past: answer. (b) feature :faith
  6. Did Ab know he was blessed? Past:yes, future:obscure. Did we know it? Because of past and Jesus
  7. How is the old blessed? Answer is  in following story - through youth.
Gen24:2
BBEAnd Abraham said to his chief servant, the manager of all his property, Come now, put your hand under my leg:
CUVS亚伯拉罕对管理他全业最老的仆人说、请你把手放在我大腿底下。
CUVpyya bo la han dui guan li ta quan ye zui lao de pu ren shuo , qing ni ba shou fang zai wo da tui di xia .
ESVAnd Abraham said to his servant, the oldest of his household, who had charge of all that he had, "Put your hand under my thigh,
KJVAnd Abraham said unto his eldest servant of his house, that ruled over all that he had, Put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh:
NIVHe said to the chief servant in his household, the one in charge of all that he had, "Put your hand under my thigh.
e_Note
  1. --the oldest of his household is likely Eliezer of Damascus  大马色人 以利以谢 Gen15:2 (Eliezer:'God is my help') 
  2. Not as old as Abraham. Longest most loyal reliable person. Devoted to God. 
     
Gen24:3
BBEAnd take an oath by the Lord, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not get a wife for my son Isaac from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I am living;
CUVS我要叫你指着耶和华天地的主起誓、不要为我儿子娶这迦南地中的女子为妻。
CUVpywo yao jiao ni zhi zhao ye he hua tian di de zhu qi shi , bu yao wei wo er zi qu zhe jia nan di zhong de nv zi wei qi .
ESVthat I may make you swear by the LORD, the God of heaven and God of the earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell,
KJVAnd I will make thee swear by the LORD, the God of heaven, and the God of the earth, that thou shalt not take a wife unto my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell:
NIVI want you to swear by the Lord , the God of heaven and the God of earth, that you will not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I am living,
e_Note
  1. Who are Canaanite women?  Gen9:18, Gen9:25, Gen9:26, Gen10:6
  2. Why not marry with? (A) health/height/weight/fat, wealth, intellectual, friendly/enemy, language, ethnic identity, beauty,  (B) cursed by (C) mission of Abraham (D) promised son (E) mission of God, Jesus. 
  3. How important? 3 degrees: most devoted, private, high. 
  4. Then, Why didn’t Abraham go for it himself? (A) old/unhealth.  (B) hometown disgusting (C) unwilling; (C) God's calling: no turning back. (D) faith. Crystal cutting off his family is a plan of God. 
Gen24:4
BBEBut that you will go into my country and to my relations and get a wife there for my son Isaac.
CUVS你要往我本地本族去、为我的儿子以撒娶一个妻子。
CUVpyni yao wang wo ben di ben zu qu , wei wo de er zi yi sa qu yi ge qi zi .
ESVbut will go to my country and to my kindred, and take a wife for my son Isaac."
KJVBut thou shalt go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son Isaac.
NIVbut will go to my country and my own relatives and get a wife for my son Isaac."
e_Note
  1. Opposite to Gen12:1 . 
  2. Abraham left native land/race/family, crudely cut old relationship, betrat to his culture. 
  3. Not to code gold, purse treasure, freedom, civilization, escape persecution/punishment,  
  4. Abraham save his family.  
  5. To betray self culture to turn to Christ is to save the people. 
  6. How Abraham love his son. What's the most important thing for the son?

ESVThen the servant ran to meet her and said, "Please give me a little water to drink from your jar."
KJVAnd the servant ran to meet her, and said, Let me, I pray thee, drink a little water of thy pitcher.
NIVThe servant hurried to meet her and said, "Please give me a little water from your jar."

ESVWhen the camels had finished drinking, the man took a gold ring weighing a half shekel, and two bracelets for her arms weighing ten gold shekels,

NIVWhen the camels had finished drinking, the man took out a gold nose ring weighing a beka and two gold bracelets weighing ten shekels.

Gen24:29
BBENow Rebekah had a brother named Laban, and he came out quickly to the man at the water-spring.
CUVS利百加有一个哥哥、名叫拉班、看见金环、又看见金镯在他妹子的手上、并听见他妹子利百加的话、说、那人对我如此如此说、拉班就跑出来往井旁去、到那人跟前、见他仍站在骆驼旁边的井旁那里．
CUVpyli bai jia you yi ge ge ge , ming jiao la ban , kan jian jin huan , you kan jian jin zhuo zai ta mei zi de shou shang , bing ting jian ta mei zi li bai jia de hua , shuo , na ren dui wo ru ci ru ci shuo , la ban jiu pao chu lai wang jing pang qu , dao na ren gen qian , jian ta reng zhan zai luo tuo pang bian de jing pang na li .

KJVAnd Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban: and Laban ran out unto the man, unto the well.
NIVNow Rebekah had a brother named Laban, and he hurried out to the man at the spring.

Gen28:14
BBEYour seed will be like the dust of the earth, covering all the land to the west and to the east, to the north and to the south: you and your seed will be a name of blessing to all the families of the earth.
CUVS你的后裔必像地上的尘沙那样多、必向东西南北开展．地上万族必因你和你的后裔得福．
CUVpyni de hou yi bi xiang di shang de chen sha na yang duo , bi xiang dong xi nan bei kai zhan . di shang wan zu bi yin ni he ni de hou yi de fu .
ESVYour offspring shall be like the dust of the earth, and you shall spread abroad to the west and to the east and to the north and to the south, and in you and your offspring shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
KJVAnd thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
NIVYour descendants will be like the dust of the earth, and you will spread out to the west and to the east, to the north and to the south. All peoples on earth will be blessed through you and your offspring.
e_Note
  1. God’s promises Gen12:1 -2, Gen13:16, Gen15:5
  2. Directions and order: west->east, north->south
  3. Trinity. 
Gen28:22
BBEAnd this stone which I have put up for a pillar will be God's house: and of all you give me, I will give a tenth part to you.
CUVS我所立为柱子的石头、也必作　神的殿．凡你所赐给我的、我必将十分之一献给你。
CUVpywo suo li wei zhu zi de shi tou , ye bi zuo _ shen de dian . fan ni suo ci gei wo de , wo bi jiang shi fen zhi yi xian gei ni .
ESVand this stone, which I have set up for a pillar, shall be God's house. And of all that you give me I will give a full tenth to you."
KJVAnd this stone, which I have set for a pillar, shall be God's house: and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto thee.
NIVand this stone that I have set up as a pillar will be God's house, and of all that you give me I will give you a tenth."
e_Note
  1. Jacob's Conditional Faith and God's unconditional love -- as long as you purse me, I blessed you even you lied and stolen the bless unfairly.
  2. In eyes of God, Jacob is better than Essaue. In eyes of culture, Essaue is a righteous victim. 
  3.  "律法和先知、到约翰为止．从此　神国的福音传开了、人人努力要进去。" (Luk16:16 CUVS)
  4. "耶稣对众人说、你们要努力进窄门．我告诉你们、将来有许多人想要进去、却是不能。" (Luk13:24 CUVS)
  5. Stone prefigure Jesus, salvation. Oil — Mesahia — priest 
  6. Abraham—the Father, Isaac—the Son, Jacob—the Spirit(dream)

Gen30:14
BBENow at the time of the grain-cutting, Reuben saw some love-fruits in the field, and took them to his mother Leah. And Rachel said to her, Let me have some of your son's love-fruits.
CUVS割麦子的时候、流便往田里去寻见风茄、拿来给他母亲利亚．拉结对利亚说、请你把你儿子的风茄给我些。
CUVpyge mai zi de shi hou , liu bian wang tian li qu xun jian feng qie , na lai gei ta mu qin li ya . la jie dui li ya shuo , qing ni ba ni er zi de feng qie gei wo xie .
ESVIn the days of wheat harvest Reuben went and found mandrakes in the field and brought them to his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, "Please give me some of your son's mandrakes."
KJVAnd Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, Give me, I pray thee, of thy son's mandrakes.
NIVDuring wheat harvest, Reuben went out into the fields and found some mandrake plants, which he brought to his mother Leah. Rachel said to Leah, "Please give me some of your son's mandrakes."

Gen32:25
BBEBut when the man saw that he was not able to overcome Jacob, he gave him a blow in the hollow part of his leg, so that his leg was damaged.
CUVS那人见自己胜不过他、就将他的大腿窝摸了一把、雅各的大腿窝、正在摔跤的时候就扭了。
CUVpyna ren jian zi ji sheng bu guo ta , jiu jiang ta de da tui wo mo le yi ba , ya ge de da tui wo , zheng zai shuai jiao de shi hou jiu niu le .
ESVWhen the man saw that he did not prevail against Jacob, he touched his hip socket, and Jacob's hip was put out of joint as he wrestled with him.
KJVAnd when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of Jacob's thigh was out of joint, as he wrestled with him.
NIVWhen the man saw that he could not overpower him, he touched the socket of Jacob's hip so that his hip was wrenched as he wrestled with the man.
e_Note
  1. To wrestle with God, God let you win. "Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you." (Mat7:7 NIV)(Mat7:7,Mat7:8,Luk11:10,Luk11:9)
  2. To wrestle with evil, Evil let you go to hell.

Gen35:18
BBEAnd in the hour when her life went from her (for death came to her), she gave the child the name Ben-oni: but his father gave him the name of Benjamin.
CUVS他将近于死、灵魂要走的时候、就给他儿子起名叫便俄尼、他父亲却给他起名叫便雅悯。

ESVAnd as her soul was departing (for she was dying), she called his name Ben-oni; but his father called him Benjamin.
KJVAnd it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Benoni: but his father called him Benjamin.
NIVAs she breathed her last - for she was dying - she named her son Ben-Oni. But his father named him Benjamin.

Gen42:24
BBEAnd turning away from them, he was overcome with weeping; then he went on talking to them again and took Simeon and put chains on him before their eyes.
CUVS约瑟转身退去、哭了一场、又回来对他们说话、就从他们中间挑出西缅来、在他们眼前把他捆绑。
CUVpyyao se zhuai shen tui qu , ku le yi chang , you hui lai dui ta men shuo hua , jiu cong ta men zhong jian tiao chu xi mian lai , zai ta men yan qian ba ta kun bang .
ESVThen he turned away from them and wept. And he returned to them and spoke to them. And he took Simeon from them and bound him before their eyes.
KJVAnd he turned himself about from them, and wept; and returned to them again, and communed with them, and took from them Simeon, and bound him before their eyes.
NIVHe turned away from them and began to weep, but then turned back and spoke to them again. He had Simeon taken from them and bound before their eyes.

Gen42:38
BBEAnd he said, I will not let my son go down with you; for his brother is dead and he is all I have: if evil overtakes him on the journey, then through you will my grey head go down to the underworld in sorrow.
CUVS雅各说、我的儿子不可与你们一同下去．他哥哥死了、只剩下他、他若在你们所行的路上遭害、那便是你们使我白发苍苍、悲悲惨惨的下阴间去了。
CUVpyya ge shuo , wo de er zi bu ke yu ni men yi tong xia qu . ta ge ge si le , zhi sheng xia ta , ta ruo zai ni men suo xing de lu shang zao hai , na bian shi ni men shi wo bai fa cang cang , bei bei can can de xia yin jian qu le .
ESVBut he said, "My son shall not go down with you, for his brother is dead, and he is the only one left. If harm should happen to him on the journey that you are to make, you would bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to Sheol."
KJVAnd he said, My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if mischief befall him by the way in the which ye go, then shall ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
NIVBut Jacob said, "My son will not go down there with you; his brother is dead and he is the only one left. If harm comes to him on the journey you are taking, you will bring my gray head down to the grave in sorrow."
e_Note
  1. Gray head down to the grave in sorrow. X4 in Gen. 
Gen45:27
BBEAnd they gave him an account of everything Joseph had said to them; and when he saw the carts which Joseph had sent for them, his spirit came back to him:
CUVS他们便将约瑟对他们说的一切话、都告诉了他．他们父亲雅各、又看见约瑟打发来接他的车辆、心就苏醒了。
CUVpyta men bian jiang yao se dui ta men shuo de yi qie hua , dou gao su le ta . ta men fu qin ya ge , you kan jian yao se da fa lai jie ta de che liang , xin jiu su xing le .
ESVBut when they told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said to them, and when he saw the wagons that Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of their father Jacob revived.
KJVAnd they told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said unto them: and when he saw the wagons which Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of Jacob their father revived:
NIVBut when they told him everything Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the carts Joseph had sent to carry him back, the spirit of their father Jacob revived.

Deu24:19
BBEWhen you get in the grain from your field, if some of the grain has been dropped by chance in the field, do not go back and get it, but let it be for the man from a strange land, the child without a father, and the widow: so that the blessing of the Lord your God may be on all the work of your hands.
CUVS你在田间收割庄稼、若忘下一捆、不可回去再取、要留给寄居的、与孤儿寡妇、这样、耶和华你　神必在你手里所办的一切事上、赐福与你。
CUVpyni zai tian jian shou ge zhuang jia , ruo wang xia yi kun , bu ke hui qu zai qu , yao liu gei ji ju de , yu gu er gua fu , zhe yang , ye he hua ni _ shen bi zai ni shou li suo ban de yi qie shi shang , ci fu yu ni .
ESV"When you reap your harvest in your field and forget a sheaf in the field, you shall not go back to get it. It shall be for the sojourner, the fatherless, and the widow, that the LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
KJVWhen thou cuttest down thine harvest in thy field, and hast forgot a sheaf in the field, thou shalt not go again to fetch it: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow: that the LORD thy God may bless thee in all the work of thine hands.
NIVWhen you are harvesting in your field and you overlook a sheaf, do not go back to get it. Leave it for the alien, the fatherless and the widow, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.

Jug3:2
BBEOnly because of the generations of the children of Israel, for the purpose of teaching them war--only those who up till then had no experience of it;
CUVS好叫以色列的后代、又知道又学习未曾晓得的战事。

KJVOnly that the generations of the children of Israel might know, to teach them war, at the least such as before knew nothing thereof;
NIV(he did this only to teach warfare to the descendants of the Israelites who had not had previous battle experience):
e_Note
240311_21 2 2 24_ed.
  1. The warfare is not about militarism technology, strategy, tactics, the art of war, surveillance, liars, etc. 
  2. it is about the justice, righteousness, the will of the the Lord. The mission of God. The obeying/relying/love God. Understanding/remember/following the Moses Law. Remember the ancestors, the mysteries and actions of God. Teaching next generation. 
  3. Praise the Lord. 
  4. Love neighbors. Support each other. Understanding each other. 
  5. Self care, prayer to God.

Jug8:3

NIVGod gave Oreb and Zeeb, the Midianite leaders, into your hands. What was I able to do compared to you?" At this, their resentment against him subsided.

Jug8:21
BBEThen Zebah and Zalmunna said, Up! Put an end to us yourself: for you have a man's strength. Then Gideon got up and put Zebah and Zalmunna to death and took the ornaments which were on their camels' necks.
CUVS西巴和撒慕拿说、你自己起来杀我们吧．因为人如何、力量也是如何。基甸就起来、杀了西巴和撒慕拿、夺获他们骆驼项上戴的月牙圈。
CUVpyxi ba he sa mu na shuo , ni zi ji qi lai sha wo men ba . yin wei ren ru he , li liang ye shi ru he . ji dian jiu qi lai , sha le xi ba he sa mu na , duo huo ta men luo tuo xiang shang dai de yue ya juan .
ESVThen Zebah and Zalmunna said, "Rise yourself and fall upon us, for as the man is, so is his strength." And Gideon arose and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and he took the crescent ornaments that were on the necks of their camels.
KJVThen Zebah and Zalmunna said, Rise thou, and fall upon us: for as the man is, so is his strength. And Gideon arose, and slew Zebah and Zalmunna, and took away the ornaments that were on their camels' necks.
NIVZebah and Zalmunna said, "Come, do it yourself. 'As is the man, so is his strength.' " So Gideon stepped forward and killed them, and took the ornaments off their camels' necks.

NIV"Next they traveled through the desert, skirted the lands of Edom and Moab, passed along the eastern side of the country of Moab, and camped on the other side of the Arnon. They did not enter the territory of Moab, for the Arnon was its border.

Rut4:4
BBEAnd it was in my mind to give you the chance of taking it, with the approval of those seated here and of the responsible men of my people. If you are ready to do what it is right for a relation to do, then do it: but if you will not do it, say so to me now; for there is no one who has the right to do it but you, and after you myself. And he said, I will do it.
CUVS我想当赎那块地的是你、其次是我、以外再没有别人了、你可以在这里的人面前、和我本国的长老面前说明、你若肯赎就赎、若不肯赎就告诉我．那人回答说、我肯赎。
CUVpywo xiang dang shu na kuai di de shi ni , qi ci shi wo , yi wai zai mei you bie ren le , ni ke yi zai zhe li de ren mian qian , he wo ben guo de chang lao mian qian shuo ming , ni ruo ken shu jiu shu , ruo bu ken shu jiu gao su wo . na ren hui da shuo , wo ken shu .
ESVSo I thought I would tell you of it and say, 'Buy it in the presence of those sitting here and in the presence of the elders of my people.' If you will redeem it, redeem it. But if you will not, tell me, that I may know, for there is no one besides you to redeem it, and I come after you." And he said, "I will redeem it."
KJVAnd I thought to advertise thee, saying, Buy it before the inhabitants, and before the elders of my people. If thou wilt redeem it, redeem it: but if thou wilt not redeem it, then tell me, that I may know: for there is none to redeem it beside thee; and I am after thee. And he said, I will redeem it.
NIVI thought I should bring the matter to your attention and suggest that you buy it in the presence of these seated here and in the presence of the elders of my people. If you will redeem it, do so. But if you will not, tell me, so I will know. For no one has the right to do it except you, and I am next in line." "I will redeem it," he said.

KJVAnd all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were sore afraid.

1Sa17:26

CUVS大卫问站在旁边的人、说、有人杀这非利士人、除掉以色列人的耻辱、怎样待他呢．这未受割礼的非利士人是谁呢、竟敢向永生　神的军队骂阵么。

KJVAnd David spake to the men that stood by him, saying, What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away the reproach from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?

1Sa17:39
BBEAnd David took Saul's sword and put the band round him over the metal coat, and was unable to go forward; for he was not used to them. Then David said to Saul, It is not possible for me to go out with these, for I am not used to them. So David took them off.
CUVS大卫把刀跨在战衣外、试试能走不能走．因为素来没有穿惯、就对扫罗说、我穿戴这些不能走．因为素来没有穿惯。于是摘脱了。
CUVpyda wei ba dao kua zai zhan yi wai , shi shi neng zou bu neng zou . yin wei su lai mei you chuan guan , jiu dui sao luo shuo , wo chuan dai zhe xie bu neng zou . yin wei su lai mei you chuan guan . yu shi zhai tuo le .

KJVAnd David girded his sword upon his armour, and he assayed to go; for he had not proved it. And David said unto Saul, I cannot go with these; for I have not proved them. And David put them off him.
NIVDavid fastened on his sword over the tunic and tried walking around, because he was not used to them. "I cannot go in these," he said to Saul, "because I am not used to them." So he took them off.

1Sa17:40
BBEThen he took his stick in his hand, and got five smooth stones from the bed of the stream and put them in a bag such as is used by sheep-keepers; and in his hand was a leather band used for sending stones: and so he went in the direction of the Philistine.
CUVS他手中拿杖、又在溪中挑选了五块光滑石子、放在袋里、就是牧人带的囊里．手中拿着甩石的机弦、就去迎那非利士人。

NIVThen he took his staff in his hand, chose five smooth stones from the stream, put them in the pouch of his shepherd's bag and, with his sling in his hand, approached the Philistine.

  4. Sling: The Word of God.

CUVS求我主我王听仆人的话．若是耶和华激发你攻击我、愿耶和华收纳祭物．若是人激发你、愿他在耶和华面前受咒诅．因为他现今赶逐我、不容我在耶和华的产业上有分、说、你去事奉别神吧。

KJVNow therefore, I pray thee, let my lord the king hear the words of his servant. NIVNow let my lord the king listen to his servant's words. If the Lord has incited you against me, then may he accept an offering. If, however, men have done it, may they be cursed before the Lord ! 2Sa7:23
BBEAnd what other nation in the earth, like your people Israel, did a god go out to take for himself, to be his people, and to make a name for himself, and to do great and strange things for them, driving out a nation and its gods from before his people?
CUVS世上有何民能比你的民以色列呢。你从埃及救赎他们作自己的子民、又在你赎出来的民面前行大而可畏的事、驱逐列邦人和他们的神、显出你的大名。
CUVpyshi shang you he min neng bi ni de min yi se lie ne . ni cong ai ji jiu shu ta men zuo zi ji de zi min , you zai ni shu chu lai de min mian qian xing da er ke wei de shi , qu zhu lie bang ren he ta men de shen , xian chu ni de da ming .
ESVAnd who is like your people Israel, the one nation on earth whom God went to redeem to be his people, making himself a name and doing for them great and awesome things by driving out before your people, whom you redeemed for yourself from Egypt, a nation and its gods?
KJVAnd what one nation in the earth is like thy people, even like Israel, whom God went to redeem for a people to himself, and to make him a name, and to do for you great things and terrible, for thy land, before thy people, which thou redeemedst to thee from Egypt, from the nations and their gods?
NIVAnd who is like your people Israel - the one nation on earth that God went out to redeem as a people for himself, and to make a name for himself, and to perform great and awesome wonders by driving out nations and their gods from before your people, whom you redeemed from Egypt?

2Sa12:18
BBEAnd then on the seventh day the child's death took place. And David's servants were in fear of giving him the news of the child's death: for they said, Truly, while the child was still living he gave no attention when we said anything to him: what will he do to himself if we give him word that the child is dead?
CUVS到第七日、孩子死了。大卫的臣仆不敢告诉他孩子死了、因他们说、孩子还活着的时候、我们劝他、他尚且不肯听我们的话、若告诉他孩子死了、岂不更加忧伤么。
CUVpydao di qi ri , hai zi si le . da wei de chen pu bu gan gao su ta hai zi si le , yin ta men shuo , hai zi hai huo zhao de shi hou , wo men quan ta , ta shang qie bu ken ting wo men de hua , ruo gao su ta hai zi si le , qi bu geng jia you shang ma .
ESVOn the seventh day the child died. And the servants of David were afraid to tell him that the child was dead, for they said, "Behold, while the child was yet alive, we spoke to him, and he did not listen to us. How then can we say to him the child is dead? He may do himself some harm."
KJVAnd it came to pass on the seventh day, that the child died. And the servants of David feared to tell him that the child was dead: for they said, Behold, while the child was yet alive, we spake unto him, and he would not hearken unto our voice: how will he then vex himself, if we tell him that the child is dead?
NIVOn the seventh day the child died. David's servants were afraid to tell him that the child was dead, for they thought, "While the child was still living, we spoke to David but he would not listen to us. How can we tell him the child is dead? He may do something desperate."

KJVBut the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bare unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she brought up for Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite:
NIVBut the king took Armoni and Mephibosheth, the two sons of Aiah's daughter Rizpah, whom she had borne to Saul, together with the five sons of Saul's daughter Merab, whom she had borne to Adriel son of Barzillai the Meholathite.

CUVS非利士人与以色列人打仗、大卫带领仆人下去、与非利士人接战．大卫就疲乏了。

NIVOnce again there was a battle between the Philistines and Israel. David went down with his men to fight against the Philistines, and he became exhausted.

2Sa21:17
BBEBut Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, came to his help, and, turning on the Philistine, gave him his death-blow. Then David's men took an oath, and said, Never again are you to go out with us to the fight, so that you may not put out the light of Israel.
CUVS但洗鲁雅的儿子亚比筛帮助大卫、攻打非利士人、将他杀死。当日跟随大卫的人向大卫起誓、说、以后你不可再与我们一同出战．恐怕熄灭以色列的灯。
CUVpydan xi lu ya de er zi ya bi shai bang zhu da wei , gong da fei li shi ren , jiang ta sha si . dang ri gen sui da wei de ren xiang da wei qi shi , shuo , yi hou ni bu ke zai yu wo men yi tong chu zhan . kong pa xi mie yi se lie de deng .

KJVBut Abishai the son of Zeruiah succoured him, and smote the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David sware unto him, saying, Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle, that thou quench not the light of Israel.
NIVBut Abishai son of Zeruiah came to David's rescue; he struck the Philistine down and killed him. Then David's men swore to him, saying, "Never again will you go out with us to battle, so that the lamp of Israel will not be extinguished."
e_Note

  1. The lamp of Israel will not be extinguished.
  2. Jesus differs from David in that He always goes out and ahead of us to battle with the enemy. His lamp never will be extinguished.

e_Note
241217_09 2 259(ed).
  1. Speak to Priest,Elders, Leads
  2. in a dark cloud -- the glory of the Lord filled this Temple.
  3. "Then Solomon said, "The Lord has said that he would dwell in a dark cloud;" (2Ch6:1 NIV)
  4. dark cloud: עֲרָפֶל  (ar-aw-fel) thick darkness, dark cloud.  (https://www.blueletterbible.org/lexicon/h62 05/kjv/wlc/0-1/)
  5. Jesus: Pray in the closed room. Mat6:6. 
  6. C.S. Lewis: for the chosen five things do not share in public. Reason: when evil knows, then manipulate it.
    According to interpretations based on C.S. Lewis's teachings and philosophy, the "five things" one should not share publicly are often considered to be:
  7. (1) personal struggles and sins,
    (2) future plans,
    (3) others' confidences,
    (4) acts of charity, and
    (5) financial details; essentially, anything that could lead to gossip, pride, envy, or a lack of privacy in sensitive areas of life.
    The "Christian privacy" must be protected. 
  8. Communist is against privacy (evil provacy)

  3. David: Psm23:6
  4. What we need think and desire is to accomplish Jesus Great Commision.

  1. An false old golden rule in OT: personal sin always leads to tribulation  (punishments)

  3. Job: break the golden rule. Sin usually leads to judgement but not always. 
  4. Job is innocent. Jesus is righteous. Scapegoat. 
  5. ""Neither this man nor his parents sinned," said Jesus, "but this happened so that the work of God might be displayed in his life." (Jhn9 :3 NIV)

他诚然担当我们的忧患、背负我们的痛苦．我们却以为他受责罚、被　神击打苦待了。" (Isa53:4 CUVS) 


"凡恒心行善、寻求 荣耀 尊贵、和不能朽坏之  [福]  的、就以永生报应他们．" (Rom2:7 CUVS) 
"你要为真道打那美好的仗、持定 永生．你为此被召．也在许多见证人面前、已经作了那美好的见证。" (1Ti6:12 CUVS) 
"我的弟兄们、你们落在百般试炼中、都要以为大喜乐．" (Jas1:2 CUVS) 

那杀身体不能杀灵魂的、不要怕他们．惟有能把身体和灵魂都灭在地狱里的、正要怕他。" (Mat10:28 CUVS) 


Attitude of tribulation toward
II. others: comfort people / brothers/sisters in bitterness.


III. self:  glorify Jesus in bitterness in front of pagans.
"我们劳苦努力、正是为此．因我们的指望在乎永生的　神．他是万人的救主、更是信徒的救主。" (1Ti4:10 CUVS) 


IV. God. 

"不叫我们遇见试探．救我们脱离凶恶。〔或作脱离恶者〕因为国度、权柄、荣耀、全是你的直到永远、阿们。〔有古卷无因为至阿们等字〕" (Mat6:13 CUVS) 
"我们日用的饮食、今日赐给我们。" (Mat6:11 CUVS) 
Job40:15
BBESee now the Great Beast, whom I made, even as I made you; he takes grass for food, like the ox.
CUVS你且观看河马．我造你也造他．他吃草与牛一样。
CUVpyni qie guan kan he ma . wo zao ni ye zao ta . ta chi cao yu niu yi yang .
ESV"Behold, Behemoth, which I made as I made you; he eats grass like an ox.
KJVBehold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.
NIV"Look at the behemoth, which I made along with you and which feeds on grass like an ox.
e_Note
240613_085817(ed).
  1. Why Behemoth and man mentioned together? 
  2. Behemoth resemble of dinosaur. 
Job40:17
BBEHis tail is curving like a cedar; the muscles of his legs are joined together.
CUVS他摇动尾巴如香柏树．他大腿的筋互相联络。
CUVpyta yao dong wei ba ru xiang bai shu . ta da tui de jin hu xiang lian lao .
ESVHe makes his tail stiff like a cedar; the sinews of his thighs are knit together.
KJVHe moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.
NIVHis tail sways like a cedar; the sinews of his thighs are close-knit.
e_Note
240613_092936(ed).
  1. tail
Job40:18
BBEHis bones are pipes of brass, his legs are like rods of iron.
CUVS他的骨头好像铜管．他的肢体彷彿铁棍。
CUVpyta de gu tou hao xiang tong guan . ta de zhi ti fang fo tie gun .
ESVHis bones are tubes of bronze, his limbs like bars of iron.
KJVHis bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.
NIVHis bones are tubes of bronze, his limbs like rods of iron.
e_Note
240613_10572 2(ed).
  1. the tube is akin to the turtle bones
Job40:19
BBEHe is the chief of the ways of God, made by him for his pleasure.
CUVS他在　神所造的物中为首．创造他的给他刀剑。
CUVpyta zai _ shen suo zao de wu zhong wei shou . chuang zao ta de gei ta dao jian .
ESV"He is the first of the works of God; let him who made him bring near his sword!
KJVHe is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.
NIVHe ranks first among the works of God, yet his Maker can approach him with his sword.
e_Note
240613_105758(ed).
  1. rank first among creature refer to Lion.
Job40:21
BBEHe takes his rest under the trees of the river, and in the pool, under the shade of the water-plants.
CUVS他伏在莲叶之下、卧在芦苇隐密处、和水洼子里。
CUVpyta fu zai lian ye zhi xia , wo zai lu wei yin mi chu , he shui wa zi li .
ESVUnder the lotus plants he lies, in the shelter of the reeds and in the marsh.
KJVHe lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.
NIVUnder the lotus plants he lies, hidden among the reeds in the marsh.
e_Note
240613_105841(ed).
  1. hidden among the reeds in march, like turtle. 
Job40:22
BBEHe is covered by the branches of the trees; the grasses of the stream are round him.
CUVS莲叶的阴凉遮蔽他、溪旁的柳树环绕他。
CUVpylian ye de yin liang zhe bi ta , xi pang de liu shu huan rao ta .
ESVFor his shade the lotus trees cover him; the willows of the brook surround him.
KJVThe shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.
NIVThe lotuses conceal him in their shadow; the poplars by the stream surround him.
e_Note
240613_105921(ed).
  1. turtle like dark and wet land
Job40:23
BBETruly, if the river is overflowing, it gives him no cause for fear; he has no sense of danger, even if Jordan is rushing against his mouth.
CUVS河水泛滥、他不发战、就是约但河的水涨到他口边、也是安然。
CUVpyhe shui fan lan , ta bu fa zhan , jiu shi yao dan he de shui zhang dao ta kou bian , ye shi an ran .
ESVBehold, if the river is turbulent he is not frightened; he is confident though Jordan rushes against his mouth.
KJVBehold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.
NIVWhen the river rages, he is not alarmed; he is secure, though the Jordan should surge against his mouth.
e_Note
240613_105943(ed).
  1. turtle can swim
Job41:1
BBEIs it possible for Leviathan to be pulled out with a fish-hook, or for a hook to be put through the bone of his mouth?
CUVS你能用鱼钩钓上鳄鱼么、能用绳子压下他的舌头么。
CUVpyni neng yong yu gou diao shang e yu ma , neng yong sheng zi ya xia ta de she tou ma .
ESV"Can you draw out Leviathan with a fishhook or press down his tongue with a cord?
KJVCanst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?
NIV"Can you pull in the leviathan with a fishhook or tie down his tongue with a rope?
e_Note
240613_091118(ed).
  1. a sea monster, identified in different passages with the whale and the crocodile (e.g. Job 41, Ps. 74:14), and with the Devil (after Isa. 2 7:1).
Job41:2
BBEWill you put a cord into his nose, or take him away with a cord round his tongue?
CUVS你能用绳索穿他的鼻子么、能用钩穿他的腮骨么。
CUVpyni neng yong sheng suo chuan ta de bi zi ma , neng yong gou chuan ta de sai gu ma .
ESVCan you put a rope in his nose or pierce his jaw with a hook?
KJVCanst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?
NIVCan you put a cord through his nose or pierce his jaw with a hook?
e_Note
240613_123431(ed).
  1. unconquerable. 
Job41:7
BBEWill you put sharp-pointed irons into his skin, or fish-spears into his head?
CUVS你能用倒钩枪扎满他的皮、能用鱼叉叉满他的头么。
CUVpyni neng yong dao gou qiang za man ta de pi , neng yong yu cha cha man ta de tou ma .
ESVCan you fill his skin with harpoons or his head with fishing spears?
KJVCanst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?
NIVCan you fill his hide with harpoons or his head with fishing spears?
e_Note
240613_091406(ed).
  1. harpoons: spears
Job41:13
BBEWho has ever taken off his outer skin? who may come inside his inner coat of iron?
CUVS谁能剥他的外衣．谁能进他上下牙骨之间呢。
CUVpyshui neng bo ta de wai yi . shui neng jin ta shang xia ya gu zhi jian ne .
ESVWho can strip off his outer garment? Who would come near him with a bridle?
KJVWho can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?
NIVWho can strip off his outer coat? Who would approach him with a bridle?
e_Note
240613_091603(ed).
  1. Snake shed outer layer of skin
Job41:14
BBEWho has made open the doors of his face? Fear is round about his teeth.
CUVS谁能开他的腮颊．他牙齿四围是可畏的。
CUVpyshui neng kai ta de sai jia . ta ya chi si wei shi ke wei de .
ESVWho can open the doors of his face? Around his teeth is terror.
KJVWho can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.
NIVWho dares open the doors of his mouth, ringed about with his fearsome teeth?
e_Note
240613_091641(ed).
  1. fearsome teeth is emphasized.
Job41:15
BBEHis back is made of lines of plates, joined tight together, one against the other, like a stamp.
CUVS他以坚固的鳞甲为可夸、紧紧合闭、封得严密。
CUVpyta yi jian gu de lin jia wei ke kua , jin jin he bi , feng de yan mi .
ESVHis back is made of rows of shields, shut up closely as with a seal.
KJVHis scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.
NIVHis back has rows of shields tightly sealed together;
e_Note
240613_091732(ed).
  1. the back is like shield, akin to the turtle.
Job41:16
BBEOne is so near to the other that no air may come between them.
CUVS这鳞甲一一相连、甚至气不得透入其间．
CUVpyzhe lin jia yi yi xiang lian , shen zhi qi bu de tou ru qi jian .
ESVOne is so near to another that no air can come between them.
KJVOne is so near to another, that no air can come between them.
NIVeach is so close to the next that no air can pass between.

Job41:17
BBEThey take a grip of one another; they are joined together, so that they may not be parted.
CUVS都是互相联络、胶结不能分离。
CUVpydou shi hu xiang lian lao , jiao jie bu neng fen li .
ESVThey are joined one to another; they clasp each other and cannot be separated.
KJVThey are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.
NIVThey are joined fast to one another; they cling together and cannot be parted.

Job41:18
BBEHis sneezings give out flames, and his eyes are like the eyes of the dawn.
CUVS他打喷嚏、就发出光来．他眼睛好像早晨的光线．〔光线原文作眼皮〕
CUVpyta da pen ti , jiu fa chu guang lai . ta yan jing hao xiang zao chen de guang xian . ( guang xian yuan wen zuo yan pi )
ESVHis sneezings flash forth light, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the dawn.
KJVBy his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
NIVHis snorting throws out flashes of light; his eyes are like the rays of dawn.

Job41:19
BBEOut of his mouth go burning lights, and flames of fire are jumping up.
CUVS从他口中发出烧着的火把、与飞迸的火星。
CUVpycong ta kou zhong fa chu shao zhao de huo ba , yu fei beng de huo xing .
ESVOut of his mouth go flaming torches; sparks of fire leap forth.
KJVOut of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.
NIVFirebrands stream from his mouth; sparks of fire shoot out.

Job41:20
BBESmoke comes out of his nose, like a pot boiling on the fire.
CUVS从他鼻孔冒出烟来、如烧开的锅、和点着的芦苇。
CUVpycong ta bi kong mao chu yan lai , ru shao kai de guo , he dian zhao de lu wei .
ESVOut of his nostrils comes forth smoke, as from a boiling pot and burning rushes.
KJVOut of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.
NIVSmoke pours from his nostrils as from a boiling pot over a fire of reeds.

CUVS他颈项中存着劲力、在他面前的都恐吓蹦跳。

KJVIn his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.
NIVStrength resides in his neck; dismay goes before him.

Job41:24
BBEHis heart is as strong as a stone, hard as the lower crushing-stone.
CUVS他的心结实如石头、如下磨石那样结实。

NIVHis chest is hard as rock, hard as a lower millstone.

Job41:26
BBEThe sword may come near him but is not able to go through him; the spear, or the arrow, or the sharp-pointed iron.
CUVS人若用刀、用枪、用标枪、用尖枪扎他、都是无用。
CUVpyren ruo yong dao , yong qiang , yong biao qiang , yong jian qiang za ta , dou shi wu yong .
ESVThough the sword reaches him, it does not avail, nor the spear, the dart, or the javelin.
KJVThe sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.
NIVThe sword that reaches him has no effect, nor does the spear or the dart or the javelin.

Job41:28
BBEThe arrow is not able to put him to flight: stones are no more to him than dry stems.
CUVS箭不能恐吓他使他逃避、弹石在他看为碎稓。
CUVpyjian bu neng kong xia ta shi ta tao bi , dan shi zai ta kan wei sui zuo .
ESVThe arrow cannot make him flee; for him sling stones are turned to stubble.
KJVThe arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.
NIVArrows do not make him flee; slingstones are like chaff to him.

Job41:30
BBEUnder him are sharp edges of broken pots: as if he was pulling a grain-crushing instrument over the wet earth.
CUVS他肚腹下如尖瓦片．他如钉耙经过淤泥。
CUVpyta du fu xia ru jian wa pian . ta ru ding ba jing guo yu ni .
ESVHis underparts are like sharp potsherds; he spreads himself like a threshing sledge on the mire.
KJVSharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.
NIVHis undersides are jagged potsherds, leaving a trail in the mud like a threshing sledge.

Psm16:11
BBEYou will make clear to me the way of life; where you are joy is complete; in your right hand there are pleasures for ever and ever.
CUVS你必将生命的道路指示我．在你面前有满足的喜乐．在你右手中有永远的福乐。
CUVpyni bi jiang sheng ming de dao lu zhi shi wo . zai ni mian qian you man zu de xi le . zai ni you shou zhong you yong yuan de fu le .
ESVYou make known to me the path of life; in your presence there is fullness of joy; at your right hand are pleasures forevermore.
KJVThou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is fulness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.
NIVYou have made known to me the path of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence, with eternal pleasures at your right hand.

Psm19:1
BBE<To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of David.> The heavens are sounding the glory of God; the arch of the sky makes clear the work of his hands.
CUVS〔大卫的诗、交与伶长。〕诸天述说　神的荣耀．穹苍传扬他的手段。
CUVpy( da wei de shi , jiao yu ling chang . ) zhu tian shu shuo _ shen de rong yao . qiong cang chuan yang ta de shou duan .
ESVTO THE CHOIRMASTER. A PSALM OF DAVID. The heavens declare the glory of God, and the sky above proclaims his handiwork.
KJVThe heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.
NIVThe heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of his hands.
e_Note
  1. Natural Law -- God's Word
  2. Rom1:19-20.  his eternal power and divine nature.
Psm32:1
BBE<Of David. Maschil.> Happy is he who has forgiveness for his wrongdoing, and whose sin is covered.
CUVS〔大卫的训诲诗。〕得赦免其过、遮盖其罪的、这人是有福的。
CUVpy( da wei de xun hui shi . ) de she mian qi guo , zhe gai qi zui de , zhe ren shi you fu de .
ESVA MASKIL OF DAVID. Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
KJVBlessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
NIVBlessed is he whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered.

BBEFor they made his spirit bitter, and he said unwise things.

KJVBecause they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.
NIVfor they rebelled against the Spirit of God, and rash words came from Moses' lips.

Pro1:2
BBETo have knowledge of wise teaching; to be clear about the words of reason:
CUVS要使人晓得智慧和训诲．分辨通达的言语．
CUVpyyao shi ren xiao de zhi hui he xun hui . fen bian tong da de yan yu .
ESVTo know wisdom and instruction, to understand words of insight,
KJVTo know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;
NIVfor attaining wisdom and discipline; for understanding words of insight;
e_Note
  1. 3-Sight: insight, foresight, hindsight. 
Pro1:7
BBEThe fear of the Lord is the start of knowledge: but the foolish have no use for wisdom and teaching.
CUVS敬畏耶和华是知识的开端．愚妄人藐视智慧和训诲。
CUVpyjing wei ye he hua shi zhi shi de kai duan . yu wang ren miao shi zhi hui he xun hui .
ESVThe fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; fools despise wisdom and instruction.
KJVThe fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
NIVThe fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and discipline. Exhortations to Embrace Wisdom
e_Note
  1. The beginning: foundation: base: origin: source: target: objective: chief: first fruit: end. 
  2. Hebrew רֵאשִׁית. the first word of Gen1:1. 
  3. Driven power: 
  4. 1Co13:8 the knowledge will be end. 
  5. i am alpha, omiga.
Pro1:8
BBEMy son, give ear to the training of your father, and do not give up the teaching of your mother:
CUVS我儿、要听你父亲的训诲、不可离弃你母亲的法则〔或作指教〕．
CUVpywo er , yao ting ni fu qin de xun hui , bu ke li qi ni mu qin de fa ze ( huo zuo zhi jiao ) .
ESVHear, my son, your father's instruction, and forsake not your mother's teaching,
KJVMy son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
NIVListen, my son, to your father's instruction and do not forsake your mother's teaching.
e_Note
  1. Compare Gen2:24.  Aba and ama represent Elohim and yhwh. 
Pro4:23
BBEAnd keep watch over your heart with all care; so you will have life.
CUVS你要保守你心、胜过保守一切〔或作你要切切保守你心〕因为一生的果效、是由心发出。
CUVpyni yao bao shou ni xin , sheng guo bao shou yi qie ( huo zuo ni yao qie qie bao shou ni xin ) yin wei yi sheng de guo xiao , shi you xin fa chu .
ESVKeep your heart with all vigilance, for from it flow the springs of life.
KJVKeep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.
NIVAbove all else, guard your heart, for it is the wellspring of life.
e_Note
  1. Whoever believes in me, as the Scripture has said, streams of living water will flow from within him."" (Jhn7:38 NIV)
  2. Chinese translation contains prosperity gospels. 
Pro6:20
BBEMy son, keep the rule of your father, and have in memory the teaching of your mother:
CUVS我儿、要谨守你父亲的诫命、不可离弃你母亲的法则．〔或作指教〕
CUVpywo er , yao jin shou ni fu qin de jie ming , bu ke li qi ni mu qin de fa ze . ( huo zuo zhi jiao )
ESVMy son, keep your father's commandment, and forsake not your mother's teaching.
KJVMy son, keep thy father's commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
NIVMy son, keep your father's commands and do not forsake your mother's teaching.
e_Note
  1. Gen2:24
Pro8:24

KJVWhen there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.
NIVWhen there were no oceans, I was given birth, when there were no springs abounding with water;

Pro9:12
BBEIf you are wise, you are wise for yourself; if your heart is full of pride, you only will have the pain of it.
CUVS你若有智慧、是与自己有益．你若亵慢、就必独自担当。
CUVpyni ruo you zhi hui , shi yu zi ji you yi . ni ruo xie man , jiu bi du zi dan dang .
ESVIf you are wise, you are wise for yourself; if you scoff, you alone will bear it.
KJVIf thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.
NIVIf you are wise, your wisdom will reward you; if you are a mocker, you alone will suffer."
e_Note
  1. psa1 1 1:10, 
  2. pro1:7
Pro10:1
BBEA wise son makes a glad father, but a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother.
CUVS所罗门的箴言。智慧之子、使父亲欢乐．愚昧之子、叫母亲担忧。
CUVpysuo luo men de zhen yan . zhi hui zhi zi , shi fu qin huan le . yu mei zhi zi , jiao mu qin dan you .
ESVThe proverbs of Solomon. A wise son makes a glad father, but a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother.
KJVThe proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.
NIVThe proverbs of Solomon: A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish son grief to his mother.
e_Note
  1. Gen2:24, Pro1:8
Pro15:1
BBEBy a soft answer wrath is turned away, but a bitter word is a cause of angry feelings.
CUVS回答柔和、使怒消退．言语暴戾、触动怒气。
CUVpyhui da rou he , shi nu xiao tui . yan yu bao li , chu dong nu qi .
ESVA soft answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
KJVA soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
NIVA gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
e_Note
  1.  Matthew 10:16 - so be wise  as serpents and innocent as doves.
  2. Good for me
  3. Educated in ccp background, I like harsh word to provoke anger to fight. 
Pro16:21
BBEThe wise-hearted will be named men of good sense: and by pleasing words learning is increased.
CUVS心中有智慧、必称为通达人．嘴中的甜言、加增人的学问。
CUVpyxin zhong you zhi hui , bi chen wei tong da ren . zui zhong de tian yan , jia zeng ren de xue wen .
ESVThe wise of heart is called discerning, and sweetness of speech increases persuasiveness.
KJVThe wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
NIVThe wise in heart are called discerning, and pleasant words promote instruction.
e_Note
  1. The pleasant world can be treacherous words. 
  2. Pro1:7 
Pro16:32
BBEHe who is slow to be angry is better than a man of war, and he who has control over his spirit than he who takes a town.
CUVS不轻易发怒的、胜过勇士．治服己心的、强如取城。
CUVpybu qing yi fa nu de , sheng guo yong shi . zhi fu ji xin de , jiang ru qu cheng .
ESVWhoever is slow to anger is better than the mighty, and he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
KJVHe that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
NIVBetter a patient man than a warrior, a man who controls his temper than one who takes a city.
e_Note
  1. knowledge help to increase patience (Pro19:1 1), patience is better than hero.
  2. to rule his spirit is harder than to take a city.
Pro19:11
BBEA man's good sense makes him slow to wrath, and the overlooking of wrongdoing is his glory.
CUVS人有见识、就不轻易发怒．宽恕人的过失、便是自己的荣耀。
CUVpyren you jian shi , jiu bu qing yi fa nu . kuan shu ren de guo shi , bian shi zi ji de rong yao .
ESVGood sense makes one slow to anger, and it is his glory to overlook an offense.
KJVThe discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
NIVA man's wisdom gives him patience; it is to his glory to overlook an offense.
e_Note
  1. A role of knowledge is to give patience. 
  2. How to get patience. If a knowledge cannot give you patience, it is less useful.
  3. Pro16:32 better than mighty hero. 
  4. Pro29:1 1 a fool give full vent to anger. 
  5. It is not correct to supress the anger by force or terror; it is through the knowlwedge to disarm the anger.
  6. Forgive 64.
Ecc5:1
BBEPut your feet down with care when you go to the house of God, for it is better to give ear than to make the burned offerings of the foolish, whose knowledge is only of doing evil.
CUVS你到　神的殿、要谨慎脚步．因为近前听、胜过愚昧人献祭、〔或作胜过献愚昧人的祭〕、他们本不知道所作的是恶。
CUVpyni dao _ shen de dian , yao jin shen jiao bu . yin wei jin qian ting , sheng guo yu mei ren xian ji , ( huo zuo sheng guo xian yu mei ren de ji ) , ta men ben bu zhi dao suo zuo de shi e .
ESVGuard your steps when you go to the house of God. To draw near to listen is better than to offer the sacrifice of fools, for they do not know that they are doing evil.
KJVKeep thy foot when thou goest to the house of God, and be more ready to hear, than to give the sacrifice of fools: for they consider not that they do evil.
NIVGuard your steps when you go to the house of God. Go near to listen rather than to offer the sacrifice of fools, who do not know that they do wrong.
e_Note
  • '你到　神的殿、要 39c12;'>谨慎  脚步．因为近前听、胜过愚昧人献祭、〔或作胜过献愚昧人的祭〕、他们  39c12;'>本不知道所作的是恶。' (Ecc5:1 CUVS)
    		•
    Ecc5:2
    BBEBe not unwise with your mouth, and let not your heart be quick to say anything before God, because God is in heaven and you are on the earth--so let not the number of your words be great.
    CUVS你在　神面前不可冒失开口、也不可心急发言．因为　神在天上、你在地下、所以你的言语要寡少。
    CUVpyni zai _ shen mian qian bu ke mao shi kai kou , ye bu ke xin ji fa yan . yin wei _ shen zai tian shang , ni zai di xia , suo yi ni de yan yu yao gua shao .
    ESVBe not rash with your mouth, nor let your heart be hasty to utter a word before God, for God is in heaven and you are on earth. Therefore let your words be few.
    KJVBe not rash with thy mouth, and let not thine heart be hasty to utter any thing before God: for God is in heaven, and thou upon earth: therefore let thy words be few.
    NIVDo not be quick with your mouth, do not be hasty in your heart to utter anything before God. God is in heaven and you are on earth, so let your words be few.
    e_Note
  • '你在　神面前不可冒失开口、也不可心急发言．因为　神在天上、你在地下、所以你的言语要寡少。' (Ecc5:2 CUVS)
  • not about the quantity, about the quality, from the spirit. 
    		•
    Ecc5:3
    BBEAs a dream comes from much business, so the voice of a foolish man comes with words in great number.
    CUVS事务多、就令人作梦、言语多、就显出愚昧。
    CUVpyshi wu duo , jiu ling ren zuo meng , yan yu duo , jiu xian chu yu mei .
    ESVFor a dream comes with much business, and a fool's voice with many words.
    KJVFor a dream cometh through the multitude of business; and a fool's voice is known by multitude of words.
    NIVAs a dream comes when there are many cares, so the speech of a fool when there are many words.
    e_Note
  • '39c12;'>事务多、就令人作梦、39c12;'>言语多、就显出愚昧。' (Ecc5:3 CUVS)
  • 事务多 -> Love of God become less, faith less, flesh increase. 
    		•
    Ecc5:5
    BBEIt is better not to take an oath than to take an oath and not keep it.
    CUVS你许愿不还、不如不许。
    CUVpyni xu yuan bu hai , bu ru bu xu .
    ESVIt is better that you should not vow than that you should vow and not pay.
    KJVBetter is it that thou shouldest not vow, than that thou shouldest vow and not pay.
    NIVIt is better not to vow than to make a vow and not fulfill it.
    e_Note
    1. 我的弟兄们、最要紧的是不可起誓．不可指着天起誓、也不可指着地起誓、无论何誓都不可起．你们说话、是就说是、不是就说不是、免得你们落在审判之下。" (Jas5:12 CUVS) 

    3. "你们又听见有吩咐古人的话、说、『不可背誓、所起的誓、总要向主谨守。』" (Mat5:33 CUVS) 
    4. "只是我告诉你们、甚么誓都不可起、不可指着天起誓、因为天是　神的座位．" (Mat5:34 CUVS) 
    5. "不可指着地起誓、因为地是他的脚凳．也不可指着耶路撒冷起誓、因为耶路撒冷是大君的京城。" (Mat5:3 5 CUVS) 
    6. "又不可指着你的头起誓、因为你不能使一根头发变黑变白了。" (Mat5:36 CUVS) 
    7. "你们的话、是、就说是．不是、就说不是．若再多说、就是出于那恶者。〔或作是从恶里出来的〕" (Mat5:37 CUVS) 

    9. During the service, we need made commitment. If you cannot directly speak. 
    10. Be careful don't fall into trap for vowing. 
    11. Why not vow? increase flesh, reduce dependency on God. Grace Only. We cannot guarantee anything 100%.  
    Isa39:8
    BBEThen said Hezekiah to Isaiah, Good is the word of the Lord which you have said. And he said in his heart, There will be peace and quiet in my days.
    CUVS希西家对以赛亚说、你所说耶和华的话甚好、因为在我的年日中、必有太平和稳固的景况。
    CUVpyxi xi jia dui yi sai ya shuo , ni suo shuo ye he hua de hua shen hao , yin wei zai wo de nian ri zhong , bi you tai ping he wen gu de jing kuang .
    ESVThen said Hezekiah to Isaiah, "The word of the LORD that you have spoken is good." For he thought, "There will be peace and security in my days."
    KJVThen said Hezekiah to Isaiah, Good is the word of the LORD which thou hast spoken. He said moreover, For there shall be peace and truth in my days.
    NIV"The word of the Lord you have spoken is good," Hezekiah replied. For he thought, "There will be peace and security in my lifetime."
